basics.name: Megan Hall
basics.label: Associate Bioinformatician
basics.summary: I graduated from Arizona State University with a B.S. in Psychology and a B.S. in Anthropology, and I currently work as an Associate Bioinformatician at the Translational Genomics Research Institute. I intend to apply to graduate school, and hope to study the relationship between the brain and behavior.

education.institution: Arizona State University, Tempe, AZ, United States

work.company: Translational Genomics Research Institute, a part of City of Hope
work.summary: Began as a Helios Scholar in 2021, became an intern, and currently work full time in the Neurogenomics Division
highlights: Presented a poster on an eight week long project on transposable elements in cerebrospinal fluid
Learned and applied knowledge about R, Jinja2, BASH, and molecular biology rapidly and efficiently

work.company: Culture and Decision Science Network Lab
work.summary: Learned about and applied research methods related to personality and social psychology through multiple projects
highlights: Presented a poster on familism moderating the relationship between hope and loss of relatedness to the future self during the COVID-19 pandemic based on results of a longitudinal study

Wrote, defended, and presented a poster on my undergraduate thesis, in which I collected data through Amazon Mechanical Turk to find out if nature acts as a buffer to potential negative effects of social media

work.company: Evolution, Ecology, and Social Behavior Lab
work.summary: Assisted in behavioral data collection and literature reviews
highlights: Discussed psychology articles from an evolutionary perspective
Assisted in formatting a standardized way to collect data online

volunteer.organization: Center for Renewable Energy and Island Sustainability
volunteer.summary: Lead developer for weather sensing project
highlights: Design firmware for distributed weather sensor network
Maintain custom data collection and storage infrastructure
Webmaster/IT Officer, IEEE Student Branch, UH Manoa, 2012-2013

awards.title: B+ Scholarship
awards.summary: Scholarships awarded to incoming freshmen and continuing students who complete a rigorous high school curriculum with a minimum overall GPA of 3.0 at a Hawai'i public school.

awards.title: First place
awards.summary: My team won first place in 2015.  See my portfolio site for more details.
